A second weekend at the RMH

daily
Our second weekend in a row – away from the hospital. Visits with Gram and Papa C.
Author

Colin C.

Published

June 19, 2023

I am not writing as often as, simply, there is not as much to say. Our days are normalish – a good thing! Currently, we are not trying to understand what is happening, or what is next. It is good to have the stress level come down and have some time for mental recovery.

The last couple days

This weekend has been at the Ronald McDonald House (RMH) – our home away from home. On Saturday my parents got into town. It has been great to share meals and visit with them. A few quick highlights:

  • Card games. Including Sam’s ongoing winning streak in crib. … I will attempt to humble him, if I can, in the week ahead.
  • A walk and ice cream. We continue to be encouraged with how Sam’s strength is returning.
  • A coffee date with Tina while Sam visited with his grandparents.
  • Father’s Day BBQ hosted by the RMH.

Upcoming

Tomorrow, June 20, we will have a fourth clinic appointment to evaluate how Sam’s blood-levels are doing and if his immune system is holding.

Concerns and victories

  • Thankful for normalish days.

  • Thankful for time with my parents.

  • Again, we are thankful that Sam is not feeling the effects of this chemotherapy round. The pending valley-of-gross appears to be getting smaller and smaller. Of course there is some concern as Sam’s blood levels continue to drop. Some days in hospital are still expected.

  • We are thankful that the treatment is working. There is also concern that it is effective to remove the cancer fully.
